content:
I'd like to remind everyone that Rob Lewis and I are organizing a meeting at Carnegie Mellon from Monday, January 6 to Friday, January 10: http://www.andrew.cmu.edu/user/avigad/meetings/fomm2020/. Monday to Wednesday will feature invited speakers on a range of topics (with a break on Wednesday afternoon), and Thursday and Friday will be a Lean workshop.

Rob and I are starting to think about how to block out the time for Thursday and Friday. Here are some things we want to fit in:
- A presentation on Lean 4 from Sebastian Ullrich and a subsequent discussion.
- A discussion of plans for mathlib, as well as infrastructure and tools for maintaining it.
- A discussion of the Formal Abstracts project.
- Short, informal presentations of recent work and work in progress.
If any of you have other suggestions for things we should budget time for, please let us know.
Is there any possibility of a recording/stream?
Yes, we should have both live streaming and recording, assuming the technology works.
FoMM / Lean Together 2020 is starting soon! We have a Zulip stream specifically for the workshop, but I wanted to post a public reminder.
Talks will stream via Zoom, with links here: http://www.andrew.cmu.edu/user/avigad/meetings/fomm2020/schedule.html
And we'll record them and put them on YouTube afterward.
Is it just me, or are the slides being washed out by the lighting?
See the chat in the FoMM/Lean Together stream. We're having A/V issues but they should be fixed later this morning.
We can't move or zoom the camera at all.
Recordings of the talks from FoMM/LT2020 are now on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlF-CfQhukNkWwZt45vkNfWfuO-tBBqPN
Please let us know if there are any issues with the videos. The screens aren't really visible, unfortunately, but each video has a link to the presenter's slides.
Many thanks Rob!
Is there a direct link to the videos?
Er, yes, I pasted the wrong link. Fixed.
Google actually found it for me and I just came back to post ;-)

We have also finalized the web pages:
http://www.andrew.cmu.edu/user/avigad/meetings/fomm2020
There are links to the talks, and also a couple of group photos at the bottom of the participants page.
I sent Rob the other files I used (graphs and Lean) but I can't find them on the web page.
Oops, that was my mistake. I'll add them now.
@Patrick Massot They are up now. Let me know if they look ok.
Yes, thanks!
